projects.title: Earnings Predictor
projects.description: I created a model to determine stock earnings prediction beats and misses. Using historical earnings and additional data on a stock it outputs a score between -1 and 1 indicating whether it will be a beat or a miss and to what extent.

projects.title: TravelText
projects.description: I created a website for documenting travel ideas. It allows for creating location nodes that can be linked together to create a plan of activities you could do on an afternoon. The trails are displayed in a thoughtful manner for browsing. WARNING: on first load it takes a while to connect to the backend and you may need to refresh, but it's worth the wait!

projects.title: Food Segmenter and Classifier
projects.description: I created an ensemble model that segments different food on a plate using the Meta Segment Anything model and identifies each segment using a fine-tuned Inception Resnet V2 model made with Tensorflow.

projects.title: PokerNow Ledger Calculator
projects.description: I created an algorithm to parse an online poker site's game results and transform it into a ledger, indicating who owes who. I created a website for my friends to use with Next.js and connected my algorithm with a Flask backend, and published it using Vercel.

projects.title: Stock Volatility and Social Media Mention Correlation
projects.description: I parsed Twitter and Reddit datasets for stock mentions, and transformed the data so that it would represent daily stock mention data . I joined this data with the daily stock price data and analyzed it for statistical significance between number of mentions and stock volatility.

projects.title: BDIG Club Website
projects.description: I created a club website with Typescript and Next.js. I integrated a Contentful content management system to enable non-technical users to update and manage content. This replaced the Squarespace site the club was using.

projects.title: Campfire Stories
projects.description: I built a website for a Hackathon that generates campfire stories using the OpenAI Text-Davinci-003 model.

projects.title: Music Genre Classifier
projects.description: I created a music genre classifier in Pytorch. It was trained on a music dataset of .wav files which I processed into mel spectrograms, a visual depiction of sound. I used a VGG-16 model with pre-trained weights. This was able to boost the accuracy and decrease training time through transfer learning. I achieved an accuracy of 75 percent over 10 genres.

projects.title: SpacePals
projects.description: I led developement of a webapp that allows users to 'capture' different space animals by taking pictures of them. I engineered the frontend system for taking photos and storing caught creatures, and connected it to the backend classification model.
